website_summaries.verdict: For reaching high trailers or for a low-incline ramp, this pair of 7.5-foot aluminum ramps with rubber fingers is a great option for ATVs, lawn mowers, or snowblowers.
pros: At 91 inches, these are longer than most of the competition
The foldable ramps include safety straps and have a plate top style
Each ramp is 11 inches wide and measures 45.5 inches by 11 inches by 6 inches when folded
33 pounds altogether, with a max capacity of 1,500 pounds between both ramps
cons: The aluminum is on the thin side, making these ramps flimsy with heavier loads

customer_reviews.title: Unsafe?
customer_reviews.text: Not a safe product. One ramp nearly collapsed under 600 lbs even though these are supposedly rated for 1500 lbs. All this while the machine was walked up verses riding it up the ramps as they claim you can. Not good. Have contacted both Amazon and Titan Distributors for either replacement to a safer set of ramps or a total refund. Would hate to see someone have a 600 lb atv roll over on top of them while using these ramps.
customer_reviews.author: William Perry

customer_reviews.title: Delivery was good and in time but
customer_reviews.text: Delivery was good and in time but..... Received this items and just used ones,. one of the 2 ramps fail, wile i was loading a 600 pound grinder on wheels. disappointed on the poor quality of the metal sheet, and how it is manufactured. I will add few pictures for your better understanding.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This unit is perfect. It is light
customer_reviews.text: I looked at a lot of Ramps before purchasing these. I wanted something that could handle anything, (Snowblower, Lawnmower(s), etc). Everything I looked at had flaws, (Heavy, to short (steep angle), wide gaps between rungs. This unit is perfect. It is light, it's got just the right angle, good traction, no big gaps, good quality, the price was perfect. I am confident I will have many years of use out of these ramps and I am very happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Dean H

customer_reviews.title: Worked better than expected
customer_reviews.text: After setting up the ramps to pull my new ATV off my truck, I was very nervous that these ramps wouldn’t hold up to the weight of my ATV with me on it (1100lbs total), but I was very wrong. They worked just great. The only reason I gave them 4 stars is because you cannot handle these ramps without leather gloves on. I found out the hard way as I now have a deep gash in my finger from one of the burred or sharp edges. Will need to go over them with a sanding disk to make them safer for handling without gloves on.
customer_reviews.author: AmeriSAbritt

customer_reviews.title: User error, low margin of error...
customer_reviews.text: I'll let the picture speak for itself, with two additions. First, I didn't know that you should have the load centered on the middle support on the ramps, apparently this is a critical point to get right or else you risk having the ramp bend. Second, toolbox was empty I would guess it's less than 400 pounds, filled with tools it is ~850 pounds.
customer_reviews.author: Jay W Vonier

customer_reviews.title: Terrible. I was able to load my cub cadet ...
customer_reviews.text: Terrible. I was able to load my cub cadet onto my truck and take it off once. I took it back to my house and tried to unload it in the same spot where I loaded it. The deck got caught and I couldn't get it off. Unreal. So terrible. The top of the ramp had a broken rung after one use. I'm returning. Please don't buy these.
customer_reviews.author: Greg Jones

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality, great price!
customer_reviews.text: These ramps just arrived, they are far better quality than I expected at this price point. Researched these for months, weighing the trade off of weight, portability, strength and cost. These appear to be the sweet spot. Sturdy but lightweight aluminum construction, most of the welds are pretty good if not perfect. The tread plates have a slight raised edge to improve traction. Halves are joined with bolts and cotter pins. Two straps are included.
customer_reviews.author: QASE

customer_reviews.title: Good traction for my mower tires
customer_reviews.text: Solid light weight ramp. Good traction for my mower tires, even when wet. Even have used them to load appliances on a doily in the back of a truck, by pulling them up the ramp. Using the provided straps I was able to tie the ramps to my bumper, but I kind of wish, at least for my application, that the straps had hooks on both ends. Watch the height of your truck bed as mine sits at near 3feet, and i could catch the deck of the mower on the ramps leading edge, if the truck was park on a slight incline. In my case, I probably should have gotten a slightly longer ramp.
customer_reviews.author: Japoro

customer_reviews.title: Excellent ramps!
customer_reviews.text: These ramps are excellent! After years of using wooden ramps I got tired of the worries(slipping, bending etc.) and decided to take the plunge due to a recent move. Of course it rained on moving day and these ramps worked perfectly(surface has excellent traction). Loaded a large snowblower, tractor, and they didn't even flex. The ramps fold up and are light weight. The straps work perfectly for the heavy loads; although had little use for them due to the rubber ends which got excellent traction on the tailgate. I searched for quite awhile and for the price these can't be beat. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: mk3

customer_reviews.title: A good product but be careful loading/unloading
customer_reviews.text: This is a good product but a word of warning. The tracks are narrow and you must be sure to go straight up and down or your mower will come off and you will crash. As long as you do that, you are fine. I have used them about 30 times and noted their narrowness the first time and was super careful after that. Quality construction and welding, Can really take a load. I would recommend them to anyone who wants to transport riding mowers and lawn tractors. Just be careful about loading/unloading.
customer_reviews.author: T. H Martin

customer_reviews.title: These are easy to move around and work well
customer_reviews.text: I like that these are light weight, fold easily, lay flat (on one side - rounded on the other FYI) and work well. I recommend setting up the tie down straps that come with it as it does not take much for the ramp to pull away from the tailgate if not strapped. I have not tried using these with really heavy equipment so keep this in mind. If you are thinking that you might walk up these in wet conditions, I might suggest adding sanded gripping tape periodically - though for vehicles with rubber tires they should grip the cut outs well. Works perfect for me. They are made well.
customer_reviews.author: Austin

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality does not match high reviews.
customer_reviews.text: The good reviews made me take a chance on these ramps, where normally I would only buy an item like this in person. The price was great. But as always the saying is true. I used these ramps to load a Polaris scrambler into a truck twice and they buckled at the welds as shown in photo. This machine and rider where no where near the capacity of these ramps. They have the harbor freight quality to them. I'm asking amazon to return these seeing as they are no use to me and would not trust a replacement for saftey issues.
customer_reviews.author: Audralee

customer_reviews.title: Difficult to install and stabilize. Unusually poor manufacture quality control.
customer_reviews.text: Seemed to be sturdy Mine are not a matched pair. One ramp will not open flush with the ramp. It is uneven with the other ramp. The directions are sketchy and incomplete at best. Never could figure how to use the cheap securing straps. I use small ratcheting straps. Would not recommend for purchase. One more thing, handle the ramps with leather gloves. The holes are punched out and are sharp as razor blade. Nursing two cuts as I write this.
customer_reviews.author: Womach

customer_reviews.title: Nice quality ramps, Would buy again any time. Owned for over three years.
customer_reviews.text: No problems loading my 2010 Kawasaki 750 into lifted trucks. My brother-in-law has also used them to load his 2 seated Polaris RZR 1000 onto trailers. Great heavy duty ramps. A few spots of porosity in some of the welds, but not too big of a deal and hasn't affected the integrity of the ramps at all. Owned for about three years now and would easily buy again. Also comes with a couple straps to keep them sucked up against the truck or trailer which are nice, but a little short. On my 1989 Chevy 1500 I had to loop them through the eye holes on the hitch because they wouldn't reach anywhere else.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: Careful when using....
customer_reviews.text: Decent ramps for the price. Lightweight, but able to load my 300 lb bike into my truck bed without sagging. Be sure to wear leather gloves when handling...every edge is razor sharp! I've sliced open fingers and cut though cloth gloves enough to learn my lesson.
customer_reviews.author: MetalPeaches

customer_reviews.title: Dangerous!  Damaged my truck and almost injured myself.
customer_reviews.text: These ramps are poorly made and are extremely dangerous. As you can see in the photo, one of the tracks tore right off due to poor welds. The ATV nearly rolled off when the ramp gave way nearly injuring the driver and damaging the tailgate of the truck. Amazon should immediately recall these ramps so they can be checked for bad welds.
customer_reviews.author: Chloe

customer_reviews.title: Just not what I had expected.
customer_reviews.text: These ramps are light weight, and easy to set-up, but they feel flimsy and were easily stressed (excessive flexing) with only the weight of a medium sized refrigerator. While I do not lift or move heavy objects, and these ramps should sufficient for all of my needs, I would not recommend attempting to use these ramps for anything close to their max capacity.
customer_reviews.author: J Crawford

customer_reviews.title: Check the Condition As Soon As Receiving
customer_reviews.text: Idea was nice but one of the the hooks at the end (where with the red rubber) wan't not placed right or damaged that it doesn't line up with others. That made it very unstable when using and came off to the ground too often. Very dangerous. Unfortunately, I did not find out until the first use which was after the returnable period. I have to say the other side with no errors in production nor damages worked great. If both side are like that one, I may have given more stars but "supposed to be heavy duty" product to be this fragile is very disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Juliam

customer_reviews.title: Easy to handy but sturdy
customer_reviews.text: We've only used them once so far, but they worked perfectly. I forgot to warn my husband about sharp edges. Fortunately, he had no issues. We had to load a 700 lb Ryobi electric riding mower into a truck for the 50 mile trip to warranty repair center. Even though the controls on the mower are a little jerky, he had no issue driving it into and out of the 10ft Uhaul truck. We bought them just so we could get our one year old mower repaired but hope to find other uses for them.They are light to carry but sturdy. We went with these because they fold.
customer_reviews.author: A RHEA

customer_reviews.title: One time use ok, use a second time, not likely
customer_reviews.text: I used the ramps to load a 6 1/2x 4x3 foot armoire. I know they say keep the load centered on the middle support. How in the world do you keep a load centered on a 1” wide beam. Design is ok, execution is very poor at best. Entire ramp is spot welded. Plates started to buckle almost losing the armoire. Definitely would not trust them to support a atv, Utv, or a riding mower. I will not use again or recommend them
customer_reviews.author: Craig S.

customer_reviews.title: Good value but beware
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these to load a garden tractor in the back of my C-10, between the height of my tailgate and the limited clearance granted by the raised deck I had a hang up. These are well built, although the supplied straps are a bit marginal, but the warning sticker calls out 36" as the maximum rise and I have to agree. I'm not going to be loading any garden tractors in full-size pickups with them again but my flatbed trailer is another story, and I expect them to work wonderfully the next time I have to move a washing machine or refrigerator.
customer_reviews.author: Todd Orton

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY
customer_reviews.text: I have used these ramps a total of 4 times since I purchased then in January of 2018. They are junk. They are flimsy and the quality of craftsmanship is terrible. The top of the ramp had faulty welds and broke free and punctured a tire on my mower. They are unsafe.
customer_reviews.author: Tim C.

customer_reviews.title: Held 1,000 pounds for me
customer_reviews.text: Used these to move a 1,000 piano down steps (with lots of safety equipment—do not try this without professional help!) and it took the weight just fine. There is a bit more flex in them than I would like so top-heavy loads can go squirrelly but that’s not really what they’re designed for. I’m saving for a better one-piece loading ramp but these have worked in the mean time.
customer_reviews.author: Clegs

customer_reviews.title: My Husband is Glad
customer_reviews.text: These ramps help my husband to load my power wheelchair into the back of our SUV. They're much better to use than our old outside carrier rack. My wheelchair is safe and dry. My husband doesn't have to fool around with strapping it down anymore. He just folds down the back of the seat of my power chair, roll the chair backwards into the rear cargo space of our 2006 Chevy Trailblazer, and then he lays the ramps down on the second row seat, and off we go!
customer_reviews.author: Princess

customer_reviews.title: Excellent  choice for mobility scooters.
customer_reviews.text: Very sturdy, light weight ramps. I used them to load a mobility scooter onto a carrier. The mobility scooter has small wheels in the front to prevent it from tipping forward when braking. Those small wheels will fall in between the " rungs" of ladder style ramp. These ramps have a semi solid surface that allows the small wheels to ride on. These also have raised sections that provide traction for the drive wheels. Overall these are nice light duty ramps.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Flowers

customer_reviews.title: I'm loading a 750lb ZTR type mower just fine. They are light weight
customer_reviews.text: I'm loading a 750lb ZTR type mower just fine. They are light weight, so easy to mover around, but I'm not sure I would load 1500lbs with them.The only complaint I have is the fingers at the top where bent during shipping. They need a little styrofoam padding in the box, shippers can be rough.
customer_reviews.author: OldManTim

customer_reviews.title: Good set of ramps
customer_reviews.text: Purchased these to load and unload power equipment into the bed of my F150. They work as advertised. Only caution is what other reviewers have noted; make sure you handle them with gloves because some of the edges are quite sharp. I have used it to load / unload my 26" snowblower as well as used it with a hand-truck to load furniture into the bed of my pickup truck. Folds to be more compact for transport & storage.
customer_reviews.author: EBR

customer_reviews.title: John Deere Dealer Approved
customer_reviews.text: Ramps arrived sooner than expected. Sturdy, yet light enough to carry. When I picked up my X320 John Deere lawn tractor from the dealer, I used my new ramps. Three employees came out to take a closer look. They were impressed with the construction, the quality, the price and the fact that these ramps fold. The manager repeatedly urged one of his men to get a pair for himself.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Thorn

customer_reviews.title: Worked great for loading my EZGO TXT cart on to a ...
customer_reviews.text: Worked great for loading my EZGO TXT cart on to a Dodge Ram 2500 6'-6" box. The only issue was the cart had a rear passenger seat which extended the length, plus a ball hitch. When I first attempted to drive up the temps the back foot rest hit the ground as the incline was too steep. I then placed the back of my truck near a small valley so the valley incline acted as a continuation of the ramps. Worked perfect. Ramps a built sturdy and easy to set up.
customer_reviews.author: weilkid

customer_reviews.title: The ramps work great, good quality
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for my Polaris 500 to put in the back of my F350. The ramps work great, good quality. I don't feel nervous about the incline as i am loading the atv. The straps that are provided with the ramps are no good. The locking mechanism is good but the strap material itself tends to pull apart and get stuck in the teeth of the clamp.
customer_reviews.author: KCS

customer_reviews.title: Light and work well
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to load my mower in on a flat surface. Previously I had to go into a ditch with homemade 2x12’s and that wasn’t an option for a new property. They worked well on getting it in the truck, but coming out the deck would catch on the lip of the side guides. To get around that, I used a grinder to shave off the first inch or two to make it flush. Works well ever since!
customer_reviews.author: Keith Mckinley

customer_reviews.title: works great!
customer_reviews.text: So far, used it only twice, works as advertised. Easy to handle and set up. I unloaded and loaded into a SUV a lawnmower and a power washer. Someone had remarked on sharp edges, but I was wearing light gloves anyways to handle machines so no problems. I agree the straps are low quality and will need to be replaced quickly. This is only reason I downgraded it to 4 starts. Did not notice any problems with the bolts.
customer_reviews.author: Wilbur0776M

customer_reviews.title: Great design. Excellent customer service
customer_reviews.text: Ramps look very sturdy and easily handled weight of my sport bike. But the one ramp had plates welded on backward so traction strips were in wrong direction making that ramp very slippery and dangerous. Picture shows left ramp lower strip welded on opposite to other sections. Poor workmanship that should never have gotten past a quality control inspection. I am inquiring about a replacement but no progress so far. Update: Titan contacted me promptly about misfabricated ramp. A correct ramp is being sent to replace it. Thanks Titan Ramps. Excellent customer service
customer_reviews.author: Allen

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and reliable
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these rails to load a 52 inch/24 hp riding mower into my ram 1500 4x4. The ramps help up very well. Sturdy and did what they are suppose to do. Lining them up and attaching the straps was easy. It is however terrifying driving a mower up the ramp into the truck. I know they don’t recommend this but we tried pushing the mower and it seemed impossible. The ramps are great though. They got the job done.
customer_reviews.author: t warren

customer_reviews.title: They do funk but they aren’t built the best
customer_reviews.text: The shipping was fast, they were just packaged in a box no extra padding (mine showed up with tons of scratches), welds were missing and half finished on some of the ramps, cut my finger open on the sharp parts they didn’t file down at the bottom of the ramps (looks awful and will have to find a way to smooth them it’s long sharp pieces of metal!)
customer_reviews.author: Phillip R

customer_reviews.title: Works perfect for sportbikes
customer_reviews.text: Great ramps. I used them to load my sportbike into the back of a pickup truck with ease. The sheet metal provides solid footing for walking the bike up. The straps work fine, just make sure they are pulled tight and they will keep the ramps from sliding around /falling back. Used them to load / unload the bike 3x this weekend and they worked great, no damage, and I was able to load the bike into the back of a Nissan Titan with ease.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Works great. I use it to get my snow blower and push mower in and out of my shed/garage which has a 3 foot drop I need to bridge. Includes two tie down straps which I use to secure it. Very light weight and manageable. The holes are small and there's minimal lip on the edges which is what I needed for my small equipment purposes. The only thing I don't like - which other reviewers have mentioned - is this is not skin friendly due to sharp edges and corners. I definitely feel the need to wear gloves while handling.
customer_reviews.author: PS03

customer_reviews.title: Best quality and best price!  Very pleased ...
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this to transport my pedi cab and it's awesome! I was curious of the quality since the price was the lowest, but I don't see any quality issues. For my pedi cab (200 lbs), this product is perfect. If I was transporting a full ATV, I might reconsider though ... everything looks strong.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Snyder, Ed.D.

customer_reviews.title: Great ramp for the price
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these ramps to load my riding lawnmower and snowblower into my 2019 Nissan Frontier. The ramps were easy to use and worked great. My only complaint is that the top edge where the fingers are were a little rough and scratched the plastic tailgate cover. I remedied this by placing some foam rubber on the fingers. The straps worked great once I figured out how to use them (YouTube is awesome!), so some detailed instructions would be nice.
customer_reviews.author: NitroMike

customer_reviews.title: Beyond the call of duty......
customer_reviews.text: As described. Handles tons of weight. If your ramps do not appear to be angled at the same level, do not return or fear. This is common, according to their customer service, which is excellent! They extended our return date over a month, in order for us to test a cart we purchased. They were willing to give full money back if not satisfied after 65 days....very generous and easy to work with! Highly recommend these ramps and Titan Ramps, the company....this is how business should be done!
customer_reviews.author: Adrian G

customer_reviews.title: Good set of ramps for my snow blower
customer_reviews.text: This is the first set of ramps that I purchased and I am very happy with the product. They are lightweight. They fold in half which makes it easy to transport them in the bed of my pickup or store on my garage shelf. I use these ramps to load my snow blower into my pick up truck bed. I have had these ramps for several years now and use them several times each winter with no problems or complaints. I would purchase these ramps again if I ever needed to.
customer_reviews.author: RJ from New York

customer_reviews.title: It does flex but easily supported the weight
customer_reviews.text: I used these to load my sportbike into the back of my truck. It does flex but easily supported the weight. I was a little disappointed in the quality of the included straps as they came loose. I used some sturdy ratchet straps to hold it in place to my vehicle and no movement of the ramps.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph M

customer_reviews.title: very good ramp
customer_reviews.text: The ramps are nice but still a little short for a 4 wheel drive truck. The reason i gave it a 4 instead of 5 is the straps provided do not work well, and you will probably need to find a better method to attach to your tailgate to prevent them from sliding off. The straps provided are weak and don't lock and unlock very easily. The ramps do seam strong and made loading my toro zero turn lawn mower easy.
customer_reviews.author: Auburn Alum

customer_reviews.title: I was very satisfied with the packaging and quality of the ramps
customer_reviews.text: The ramps arrived sooner than expected. I was very satisfied with the packaging and quality of the ramps. As I read in previous reviews, there were a few sharp edges on the bottom side of the ramps and the cotter pins were not bent over on the hinge nut which could cause injury if not careful. Each of safety straps only have one hook on one end with the directions clearly showing 2 hooks per strap. All of these negative points are all minor inconveniences for me, but for the price I am extremely pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis

customer_reviews.title: Look like well built ramps
customer_reviews.text: Just received them, they look to be well built, although I wish the deck material was a little beefier, though for its intended use with wide pneumatic tires spreading the load across the width of the ramp, I don't see how these could be beat (especially considering the price.) For what I want to use these for, I plan to add a second layer of decking with smooth .063" aluminum plate with traction tape added so that the deck can handle solid smaller wheels (such as casters or an appliance dolly) without too much flex.
customer_reviews.author: Craig C

customer_reviews.title: light light weight
customer_reviews.text: Just got it today and have already used it four times twice for a 4-wheeler and twice for a zero turn lawn mower. Very light easy to unfold, fold back up and store. That's my report for day one.
customer_reviews.author: Reader Boy

customer_reviews.title: very satisfied and safe with this acquisition.
customer_reviews.text: although this ramp has been designed for small tractors, quadricycles, motorcycles and so on. I use to get inside my travel trailer. for me as a wheelchair person it is important to feel safe and this ramp is simply versatile lightweight and extremely well built, very satisfied and safe with this acquisition.
customer_reviews.author: Bruno PIres

customer_reviews.title: Light and durable!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to set up and light enough to maneuver without injury concern. I use them to load a flip over ice house into my truck and they work perfect. Just don’t slide it down...the one-way grip carves the plastic.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works Great
customer_reviews.text: After using them several times already I can honestly state they work very well, they're light yet sturdy and easy to handle. My only suggestion would be to add an eye ring on them to make the safety strap easier to secure.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth A. Giorno

customer_reviews.title: light and easily maneuverable. They store well either in the trailer ...
customer_reviews.text: I have found the ramps very well made,light and easily maneuverable.They store well either in the trailer or in the back of the car.In addition to the quad I have a trike bicycle that is electric assist so is relatively heavy to move so the ramps make it easy to load into the trailer.Also have a regular bicycle with a Bionx electric assist and it is also run up the ramps into the trailer.Means I don't have to lift 80 pounds directly off the ground with an awkward piece of equipment
customer_reviews.author: Sasquatch #3

customer_reviews.title: Very Very Good for the Cost.
customer_reviews.text: Fast shipping, arrived on Wednesday and used on Friday. I used these to load/unload an electrical generator 200+ lbs. I especially like the light weight of aluminum. I'm pleased with the ramps and recommend. The only criticism I can see is the instructions don't give details on how to use the provided straps for securing the ramps. The instruction show two hooks, one on each end, but the straps have a hook on one end and a loop on the other end. As a result I did not use the straps. But I wouldn't let the straps stop me from buying these ramps.
customer_reviews.author: DuckMann

customer_reviews.title: Ramp is good for a one man job
customer_reviews.text: Although I purchased this almost 2 years ago, I just used it (a month ago) to roll my walking lawn mower into my van and take it in for a spring tune up. This comes in handy for heavy items ON WHEELS, and you don't currently have a neighbor to assist you. Just ensure the rams are lined up with the width of your wheels before you start to push your item. The ramp is very light weight and easy to maneuver; and, folds up great.
customer_reviews.author: S. Pughsley

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY - Horrible! DANGEROUS!
customer_reviews.text: DANGEROUS! DO NOT BUY! Seller claimed 1,500 LBs, I put 300 LBs on these ramps and the top plated dented. Snow blower almost felt off the ramps. Do Not Buy!
customer_reviews.author: Amazoner

customer_reviews.title: Light weight ramp
customer_reviews.text: Easy to set up and use; light weight and portable; appears well made, all welds look good on inspection: there are some sharp edges, but keep in mind this is welded aluminum, be careful!
customer_reviews.author: Perry K. Wilkerson

customer_reviews.title: Very Well Made
customer_reviews.text: These are working great for me and the quality exceeded my expectations. I use them to load my heavy mower into my Ram 1500 4x4; the mower is appx 300lb. They fold and are quite light for their strength.
customer_reviews.author: Rik Tweed

customer_reviews.title: As advertised
customer_reviews.text: Purchased these ramps for occasional transport of riding mower and equipment. Used immediately to load a 300-plus pound brush hog. The ramps are lightweight and yet barely bent under weight. Felt totally secure. No assembly necessary except to secure the straps which were adequate for the purpose. Excellent product for the price and arrived on first day of delivery window estimate. The only thing that would possibly be better is a larger rail ridge on the sides to prevent driving over.
customer_reviews.author: Kenley F.

customer_reviews.title: Easy to handle
customer_reviews.text: They are what I was looking for at the price. The welds are good. They fold easily, short enough to fit in my truck bed and light enough to manage easily. I bought them as a walking ramp into my RV because my 89 year old mother does not do stairs well any more. They flex more than I had hoped but they are OK for my purpose, especially for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Lee Nave

customer_reviews.title: Decent Ramps For The $$$ Paid
customer_reviews.text: Usual issues that others have already commented on about these ramps, but all'n all, decent ramps for the 💰...I would probably buy the longer, solid "Tri-fold" ramps next time, as running an ATV up & down these is "sketchy at best!" Individual ramps tend to move around somewhat, when getting on & off them from my truck!
customer_reviews.author: KVW

customer_reviews.title: Great set of ramps
customer_reviews.text: Great set of ramps. I use these for my Jazzy Select Elite wheelchair loading into the SUV and they work great. They don't flex under the heavy weight and came with two ratchet strays to help support it during loading and offloading.
customer_reviews.author: mac

customer_reviews.title: Very Nice !!!
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for Dad and he loves them, said he folds them up and slips them behind his truck seat so he doesn't have to leave them in the bed and possibly get stolen.
customer_reviews.author: T. Rice

customer_reviews.title: Incomplete order
customer_reviews.text: Did not receive all the required hooks for the straps. The lower hooks were missing. Useless without them. Incomplete order. Update: After going back and forth with Amazon and Titan Ramps, Titan has agreed to send me new ramps. Will update again when they arrive.
customer_reviews.author: RoboDude

customer_reviews.title: Easy to handle
customer_reviews.text: I am really impressed with the performance, ease of use, and light weight. Easy to handle. The small cutouts in the tread surface allow for all kinds of wheels to run over easily, including very small diameter wheels on mowers or tillers. And plenty beefy enough for most riding mowers with rider on board. Should have bought this pair years earlier.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Ehhh
customer_reviews.text: Expect what you pay for. These were very inexpensive and behave accordingly. I rode my dirtbike up the ramp (440 total pounds) and it bent each of the cross plates on the way up. Will be pushing the bike up from now on.
customer_reviews.author: Miranda Carpenter

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight and folds
customer_reviews.text: Cutout vents are very sharp. Wear gloves when handling. Holding straps are ok but not high quality but easily replaced. That is a small issue since made the purchase for the quality of the ramps. Lightweight. Haven’t used it yet.
customer_reviews.author: mfd in Iowa

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight not the best
customer_reviews.text: Used once for John deer rider 115 and already some damage. It worked but is now damaged slightly. Not the best quality but decent for the price.
customer_reviews.author: cyberclone

customer_reviews.title: Great ramps.
customer_reviews.text: I use this to drive my John Deere S240 into the shed which is about 2' off the ground. They feel very study and are lightweight. I appreciate they don't scissor completely together, already saved my fingers some pain. I can back out without them slipping as well, although should probably use a strap as directed.. Who has time for all that? If it wasn't sitting on wood I would.
customer_reviews.author: Collin

customer_reviews.title: Work well for moving appliances
customer_reviews.text: Ramps are compact, light weight and well constructed. My only request would be better straps for securing the ramps the truck. Those provided have a buckle rather than a ratchet, and are tedious to use. I gave four stars instead of five for sturdiness because there's a good amount of flex when moving a heavy appliance on a dolly, and while flexing is what ramps are designed to do, I wish it flexed less.
customer_reviews.author: GenerallyHappy

customer_reviews.title: Solid and Steady
customer_reviews.text: I've only had to use these a coupe of times but these are perfect. I put them together to roll a dolly up that's too wide for one and for walking a scooter up. They do not move, do not bend, do not creak, and all this in a light weight ramp.
customer_reviews.author: Long Time Amazonian

customer_reviews.title: that's me and they are great. Just what I needed
customer_reviews.text: I read the reviews and found a couple that mentioned using them for transporting a power chair.... yup, that's me and they are great. Just what I needed. Light weight, easy to handle, and they came with security straps. Up went my chair and off I went to enjoy my activity. Thanks Titan!! I would recommend these ramps to anyone who asks.
customer_reviews.author: Mountain Mama

customer_reviews.title: WORK PERFECTLY
customer_reviews.text: These loading ramps work great. Just don't expect them to do things they cannot do. Don't overload them, make sure you connect the safety straps, etc. Really glad I bought these, I have needed them for a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Seeker

customer_reviews.title: Built solid and easy to use. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.text: Waited a full year to post this review. These have held up to many heavy loads in and out of my cargo van. Built solid and easy to use. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Ken Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Durable, Light weight, Affordable
customer_reviews.text: Ramps are very durable yet light weight feel less than 15lbs each. Bought them to load and unload atv. Used them to load and unload 700 Harley and worked perfect with one ramp. Easy loading and unloading with the flatter surface. Tie straps included and work nicely to secure to tailgate. My truck is lifted a small bit and angle wasn’t too steep at all. For how light weight, affordable, and durable they are I would definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Jake D.

customer_reviews.title: Very nice heavy duty ramps that are wide enough to feel ...
customer_reviews.text: Very nice heavy duty ramps that are wide enough to feel comfortable. They are light weight to make it easy to load and unload the ramps, but are strong enough for my Grizzly 700. They are well made and even include a security strap to hook on the pickup so that the ramps can't slide off. I highly recommend this product, especially for the price. A great value.
customer_reviews.author: Don

customer_reviews.title: Nice compact option.
customer_reviews.text: Nice, strong, lightweight, compact. Using this for my utility shed to get the riding mower in and out. Seems to work fine. Not sure how well it would perform for getting objects into a truck, but works for me. I only have about a 2 foot climb into the shed.
customer_reviews.author: Fenderheight

customer_reviews.title: These are the ones to buy for home/consumer use, period.
customer_reviews.text: Have used them now several times with large lawn tractor. Could not ask for a better product at this very fair price.
customer_reviews.author: constanceyarbury

customer_reviews.title: Not reliable.
customer_reviews.text: After first use, both ramps were bended.....it’s for very light use, not 600lb... Very frustrated. :(
customer_reviews.author: rasim

customer_reviews.title: Great ramp! I use it for my Kubota BX2230
customer_reviews.text: Nice product, I use it for a Kubota 2230 with front end loader
customer_reviews.author: RjLombardi

customer_reviews.title: DANGEROUS - BAD WELDS
customer_reviews.text: Not a safe product. I ignored the bad welds comments and wish I hadn't. These were used for loading and unloading a 250cc dirtbike weighing about 230 pounds. This is SO much lighter than they are rated for. (1500 pounds) I'm thankful my son's leg didn't go through the ramp. These are downright dangerous.
customer_reviews.author: Shari Wyllie

customer_reviews.text: These are absolutely amazing. Super sturdy and light weight. Had a shorter set of these from a different brand that felt like they were going to cave in on me every time I used them. These are super sturdy and extremely light weight. Everyone that sees me use them and tries them asks where i got them...and they're half the price of the competitors.
customer_reviews.author: Tmt93

customer_reviews.title: These are GREAT! The length combined with the arch
customer_reviews.text: These are GREAT! The length combined with the arch, avoids dragging the mower deck on the ramps. The plate top, verses the ladder style, makes for a much smoother ride and therefore much safer. They are strong (1500 lb. load rating) yet light weight and easy to handle and store. One word of caution, wear gloves when handling them. Like any punched out holes in sheet metal, there are some sharp edges on the underside, not real bad but they are there.
customer_reviews.author: C. Price

customer_reviews.title: EXCELLENT CHOICE!!!!
customer_reviews.text: High quality. Light weight. They fold in half for easy transport and storage. Two ramps come in box. Each has a safety strap to secure ramp during use. Very happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: mad2live

customer_reviews.title: Good multi purpose ramps
customer_reviews.text: I haven’t had a chance to use yet but have used my sons which are identical. I used his to unload a gas powered generator and they worked great.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth/Vickie S.

customer_reviews.title: ATV loading ramps
customer_reviews.text: I have only used these a handful of times but so far they have been great. My bike loaded with me on it probably weighs close to 1000 lb's. No problems so far!
customer_reviews.author: Braddog

customer_reviews.title: Poor
customer_reviews.text: Poor welds on the one ramp. Like I would expect these to be welded a lot better than this. I work in a metal shop and this would never pass the quality control process.
customer_reviews.author: Gordon Liddy

customer_reviews.title: Work great!
customer_reviews.text: They work great. Straps it comes with are fine. No they are not ratcheting straps but they hold well. I use these to load a raptor 700 into a truck with me riding. Im about 220lbs. No flex at all.
customer_reviews.author: CaliBandit

customer_reviews.title: Perfect, very pleased!
customer_reviews.text: Works perfectly to get my riding lawn mower into the work shed that is elevated, (on skids). Tried shorter ramps first, but the mower deck wouldn't clear the front edge going into the shed. I was originally a little apprehensive about the strength of the ramps, but they've been great, no problem!
customer_reviews.author: TomB

customer_reviews.title: Quality at a great price
customer_reviews.text: Ordered my ramps and received them 3 days later, I was able to use them the first day, great quality at a great price. The ramps are lightweight and easy to move around, I have a 2017 F-350 FX4 dually so it sits a little higher than a normal pickup but these ramps are a great help with loading my ATV, plenty of length for the additional height.
customer_reviews.author: Dale Anthony

customer_reviews.title: They stayed in place nicely during use as well
customer_reviews.text: These ramps were exactly what we needed. Foldable, light, works on my husband's Lincoln Mark LT (basically a Ford F-150). We used them to transport large sound racks for an event. The edges were not sharp and even with the substantial weight of each item, there was no bowing. They stayed in place nicely during use as well. Very very pleased with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Whaley

customer_reviews.title: Just what we needed to move heavy equipment to our Suburban
customer_reviews.text: These ramps are perfect for moving heavy equipment into the back of our Suburban. They're relatively light weight and fold nicely for storage.
customer_reviews.author: MK Bartholomew

customer_reviews.title: Well packed so they arrived in good condition. Well made
customer_reviews.text: Well packed so they arrived in good condition.Well made. I am using these ramps for smaller items like lawn mower, tiller, snow blower. The ramps work nice for things with smaller wheels. Not sure how well these would do with an ATV but I imaging they would work well. They are light in weight and fold nicely so they are easy to move and store.
customer_reviews.author: A. Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Great product, very sturdy
customer_reviews.text: My husband loves using these ramps for loading/unloading our snowblower and lawnmower from our shed to our home. I wasn't too sure it would work, but he said it works fantastic! Very sturdy and well made! Sure saves his back from trying to lift those machines onto and from his truck!
customer_reviews.author: JuneauGal

customer_reviews.title: Nice Ramps
customer_reviews.text: I use the ramps to load my dirt bike. The ramps have good grip even when wet due to the raised areas at the holes. Other posts have stated that these have sharp edges. There were no sharp edges on the ramps I received. These work well for what I use them for.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The ramps work good. However the instructions said the 2 straps came ...
customer_reviews.text: The ramps work good. However the instructions said the 2 straps came with 2 hooks each (one for the ramp , one for the truck) to secure them and there was only 1 hook on each strap. There is no way for the straps to work unless you purchase another hook, which is what we had to do.
customer_reviews.author: Sonna

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight
customer_reviews.text: I love how lightweight these things are. Perfect for anything less than 600lbs. They get a little bendy over 600lbs.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: GOOD loading ramps
customer_reviews.text: Ramps are constructed as described and easy to use. The plastic-coated metal tabs at the end placed on the vehicle protect the vehicle well and provide some degree of "anti-slip" compared to bare metal. The ramps fold and unfold easily. They are sufficiently light but also appear to be plenty strong for advertised purposes. Used only a couple of times at this point, but well pleased with this product so far.
customer_reviews.author: kb

customer_reviews.title: The ramp itself is nice. The instructions show 2 hooks on each strap ...
customer_reviews.text: The ramp itself is nice. The instructions show 2 hooks on each strap to hold to your truck and ramp for safety but the straps don't come with the 2 hooks shown in the instructions, misleading. Plus, i found it cheaper elsewhere with the safety hooks.
customer_reviews.author: Fit Dad

customer_reviews.title: Great Ramps
customer_reviews.text: I bought these ramps a while back but hadn't given them a good test until my recent move. Held up great with my riding mower, snowblower, generator and other items. I look forward to using them more in the future.
customer_reviews.author: CPAT21

customer_reviews.title: Great deal
customer_reviews.text: I move a lot of riding mowers, and these ramps are perfect for loading and unloading my trailer. The included safety straps used to secure the ramps to a truck/trailer greatly reduce the chance of the ramps moving and causing a potentially dangerous accident.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not very sturdy
customer_reviews.text: I really don’t think these ramps will hold up. They are pretty flimsy. They feel like they are about to buckle just walking on them and I’m 165lbs.! There is no way I’m going to trust them loading my 600lbs. quad. I hope I can return! I hate giving bad reviews but these ramps are a couple steps up from a ramp made out of pop cans!
customer_reviews.author: Peter Boen

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight and strong
customer_reviews.text: These ramps made it very easy to get my 4-wheeler on and off the bed of my truck. The safety straps are quick and easy to hook up and secure the ramps to the truck very well. They fold for easy storage and are extremely lightweight. So far they have proven to be very strong. I highly recommend these ramps.
customer_reviews.author: GT

product_meta.title: Titan 7.5 FT Aluminum Plate Top Ramp 2PK 1,500 LB Capacity Lawn Mower ATV Truck Loading Ramps
feature_bullets: CAPACITY OF 1,500-POUNDS: These ramps are ideal for transferring any four-wheeled vehicle to a truck trailer. Use a single ramp to transport a dirt bike or motorcycle and use both to load an ATV, 4-wheeler, or lawnmower onto a truck bed. Titan’s 7.5-foot aluminum ramps are both sturdy and versatile with their 1,500-pound capacity. Take your vehicles with you wherever you go with Titan’s load ramps!

IDEAL ATV, DIRT BIKE, AND LAWN MOWER LOADING RAMPS: Whether you’re transporting an ATV a few miles or all the way across the country, Titan ramps will help get the job done. The arched ramp design allows for optimal clearance, ensuring a smooth lift every time. These ramps are ideal for any mid-size tires including ATV tires and 4-Wheeler tires. They also make great lawn mower loading ramps.

SAFETY STRAPS INCLUDED: No need to purchase safety straps separately! These truck tailgate ramps include heavy duty load straps to keep the ramp firmly attached to the tailgate. This ensures safe transfer onto a truck without collapsing or buckling. Use them again and again to keep your 4x4 ATV, mini 4 wheeler, or lawn mower safe during transfer.

A FOLDING ALUMINUM RAMP WITH STURDY CONSTRUCTION: Each component of these trailer ramps is designed with optimal function in mind. They fold for easy transportation and only weigh 33 lbs, making them easy to move and operate. Rubber tipped fingers provide extra security to your vehicle while also preventing damage to the tailgate.

PORTABLE MUST-HAVE ATV AND 4-WHEELER ACCESSORIES: ATVs and 4-wheelers are great for navigating backcountry and dirt roads, but Titan truck bed ramps are a necessity if you need to take your vehicles farther from home. With its 1,500-pound capacity, it can easily handle even the heaviest of ATVs. No other loading ramp compares in quality, affordability, or portability.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars878 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
